trans-unit.source: The syntax of dataType is described in . The dataType can be omitted only if you specify a generationClause. If you omit the dataType, the type of the generated column is the type of the generationClause. If you specify both a dataType and a generationClause, the type of the generationClause must be assignable to dataType.

seg-source.mrk: The syntax of dataType is described in .
The dataType can be omitted only if you specify a generationClause.
If you omit the dataType, the type of the generated column is the type of the generationClause.
If you specify both a dataType and a generationClause, the type of the generationClause must be assignable to dataType.

If you specify both a dataType and a generationClause, the type of the generationClause must be assignable to dataType.

trans-unit.source: For the definition of a default value, a <varname>defaultConstantExpression</varname> is an expression that does not refer to any table. It can include constants, date-time special registers, current schemas, users, roles, and null:

seg-source.mrk: For the definition of a default value, a <varname>defaultConstantExpression</varname> is an expression that does not refer to any table.
It can include constants, date-time special registers, current schemas, users, roles, and null:

target.mrk: For the definition of a default value, a <varname>defaultConstantExpression</varname> is an expression that does not refer to any table.
It can include constants, date-time special registers, current schemas, users, roles, and null:

trans-unit.source: defaultConstantExpression: NULL | CURRENT { SCHEMA | SQLID } | USER | CURRENT_USER | SESSION_USER | CURRENT_ROLE | DATE | TIME | TIMESTAMP | CURRENT DATE | CURRENT_DATE | CURRENT TIME | CURRENT_TIME | CURRENT TIMESTAMP | CURRENT_TIMESTAMP | literal

seg-source.mrk: defaultConstantExpression: NULL | CURRENT { SCHEMA | SQLID } | USER | CURRENT_USER | SESSION_USER | CURRENT_ROLE | DATE | TIME | TIMESTAMP | CURRENT DATE | CURRENT_DATE | CURRENT TIME | CURRENT_TIME | CURRENT TIMESTAMP | CURRENT_TIMESTAMP | literal

target.mrk: defaultConstantExpression: NULL | CURRENT { SCHEMA | SQLID } | USER | CURRENT_USER | SESSION_USER | CURRENT_ROLE | DATE | TIME | TIMESTAMP | CURRENT DATE | CURRENT_DATE | CURRENT TIME | CURRENT_TIME | CURRENT TIMESTAMP | CURRENT_TIMESTAMP | literal

trans-unit.source: For details about Derby <varname>literal</varname> values, see <xref href="crefsqlj31068.dita#crefsqlj31068"></xref>.

target.mrk: For details about Derby <varname>literal</varname> values, see <xref href="crefsqlj31068.dita#crefsqlj31068"></xref>.

trans-unit.source: The values in a <varname>defaultConstantExpression</varname> must be compatible in type with the column, but a <varname>defaultConstantExpression</varname> has the following additional type restrictions:

seg-source.mrk: The values in a <varname>defaultConstantExpression</varname> must be compatible in type with the column, but a <varname>defaultConstantExpression</varname> has the following additional type restrictions:

target.mrk: The values in a <varname>defaultConstantExpression</varname> must be compatible in type with the column, but a <varname>defaultConstantExpression</varname> has the following additional type restrictions:

trans-unit.source: If you specify USER, CURRENT_USER, SESSION_USER, or CURRENT_ROLE, the column must be a character column whose length is at least 8.

seg-source.mrk: If you specify USER, CURRENT_USER, SESSION_USER, or CURRENT_ROLE, the column must be a character column whose length is at least 8.

target.mrk: If you specify USER, CURRENT_USER, SESSION_USER, or CURRENT_ROLE, the column must be a character column whose length is at least 8.

trans-unit.source: If you specify CURRENT SCHEMA or CURRENT SQLID, the column must be a character column whose length is at least 128.

seg-source.mrk: If you specify CURRENT SCHEMA or CURRENT SQLID, the column must be a character column whose length is at least 128.

target.mrk: If you specify CURRENT SCHEMA or CURRENT SQLID, the column must be a character column whose length is at least 128.

trans-unit.source: If the column is an integer type, the default value must be an integer literal.

seg-source.mrk: If the column is an integer type, the default value must be an integer literal.

target.mrk: If the column is an integer type, the default value must be an integer literal.

trans-unit.source: If the column is a decimal type, the scale and precision of the default value must be within those of the column.

seg-source.mrk: If the column is a decimal type, the scale and precision of the default value must be within those of the column.

target.mrk: If the column is a decimal type, the scale and precision of the default value must be within those of the column.
